Title: If $\frac{a}{b} = \frac{c}{d}$ why does $\frac{a+c}{b + d} = \frac{a}{b} = \frac{c}{d}$?
Content: Can anyone prove why adding the numerator and denominator of the same ratios result in the same ratio? For example, since $\dfrac{1}{2}=\dfrac{2}{4}$ then $\dfrac{1+2}{2+4}=0.5$.
AcceptedAnswer:
Sketch: If you have $\frac{p}{q}$ and $\frac{\lambda p}{\lambda q}$, then
$$
\frac{p+\lambda p}{q+\lambda q}=\frac{(1+\lambda)p}{(1+\lambda)q}=\frac{p}{q}
$$
provided $1+\lambda\not=0$.
